neighborhood_overview:
Polanco is a great neighborhood to walk by.
There are lots of good restaurants, bars, shopping centers (Antara) and metro station...(Polanco Station is two blocks away).

Polanco is a business and embassies district and of course the best museums in town are located there.
If you enjoy jogging you can take a look to Chapultepec park or a track in Ghandi Avenue.

Polanco es un barrio genial para caminar, todo esta a la mano y cuenta con restaurantes de todo tipo, bares y centros comerciales (Antara y Carso). El depa esta a solo dos calles caminando del metro Polanco.
La colonia es un distrito donde hay muchas empresas, embajadas y desde luego los mejores museos tambi√©n.
Si le gusta correr y hacer ejercicio puede ir al parque de Chapultepec o a la pista en Av. Ghandi donde podr√° encontrar corredores habituales y yoguis.
En fines de semana puede hacer bicicleta, le proporcionamos una tarjeta ECOBICI que es un programa citadino para renta de bi

name: Artist Studio in CDMX, big terrace
description:
A creative, unique and vibrant oasis in the heart of Mexico City for those looking for a place to create (design, writing, art, music), immersed within a special and extraordinary, sustainable architectural design, where a large terrace links different open and green spaces that invite reflection and inspiration. Each space has a purpose with the lines of research and interests of the artists who share their studio with the guests.

The space
The accommodation is spacious and bright, directly linked to a large terrace, which allows you to work comfortably indoors or outdoors covered from rain and sun.

The interior covered with wood provides a modern and attractive decoration that inspires creativity and productivity, the workspace allows two people working simultaneously, equipped with Wi-Fi and ethernet ports for users who need to connect their equipment via cable.

Equipped with two beds, it can comfortably accommodate a couple or a lone c
neighborhood_overview: Iztacalco is the oldest neighbor in Mexico City, even older than Tenochtitlan. Nowadays the neighbor has a dynamic life, surrounded by wood  and small shops you can feel the mexico city life far from touristic places
host_about:
Hector is a designer and consultant on sustainability, art and design issues. His firm belief about the multidimensionality of human beings has led him to study different fields of knowledge and develop his work under this vision. 
He is co-founder of BIOe where among his costumers and partners have developed a methodology to pursue habitat performance with a holistic view.
His interest in sustainability led to the creation of CUBE, an ONG with a tremendous growth becoming a reference on sustainability education with more than fifteen exhibitions and conferences in just two years since its creation. 
He firmly believes that everyone is an agent of change: a designer, and as co-founder of primal has been responsible for assembling multidisciplinary teams to develop design projects for companies as diverse as Scribe, Rothenberger, Televisa and Museo de Arte Carrillo Gil.
He is co-founder of ‚Äúlimit‚Äù a project which addresses the relation between workers and their infinite possibilities as human beings through art. 
Hector is a decided Plexant.

Entrepreneur interested in new technologies, art, architecture and design

The Roma neighborhood was built at the end of the 1800's and during the first part of the 20th century to be inhabited by the richest residents of the city.
You can spend days walking around the area and enjoying its beautiful and eclectic architecture that includes Art Nouveau, Art Deco, Modernist and lately contemporary developments that fill the spaces in the area.
Currently, Roma Norte is a hip neighborhood, safe and full of innumerable and fantastic restaurants

name: 3br in Historic Mansion Steps from the Cathedral
description:
Architecturally important 17th century palace. This grand home sleeps up to 8 guests in 3 beautifully decorated, en-suite bedrooms and offers butler service.

Delight in the use of this historical family manor, carefully restored with a prestigious art collection. Pricing for all three bedrooms for your family or friends with gorgeous views of the Cathedral and Zocalo. Close to museums, dining & shopping. Contact us for single bedroom pricing.

The space
The house on Seminario 12 is built on top of the remains of the Ceremonial Center of the Aztec City of Tenochtitl√°n. The land was subdivided by Hern√°n Cort√©s and adjudicated to one of his lieutenants, Pedro de Maya However, the construction of the house as it can be seen now, dates 1626.

This family residence belonged to two of the oldest estates of the Spanish colony, to that of Hernando de Avila during the first years of the century, and to the L√≥pez de Peralta estate between 1624 and 175
neighborhood_overview: The Historical Center of Mexico City is over 600 blocks.  Large parts of the Centro are safe, but some are not.  We encourage you to keep your valuables close, and to use uber services.  The plaza in front of the house empties up after 8pm, and we recommend that you keep your eyes open as a precaution.
host_about: We are a Mexico City based couple with four children.  Carolina is a documentary film producer and an activist.  Cesar is a visual artist and a designer.  We believe in the power of community and we are available to meet up with our guests to share information and contacts if they so require.

MyPlace Leisure Homes

name: Emporio Ciudad de M√©xico
description:
A recently renovated historic building with a relaxing roof garden equipped with a grill, a gym, a laundry room, and a lot of charm.

Fully equipped bedroom loft with one queen bed and a very functional sofa bed that transforms either in two twins or one queen-size bed. TV with Netflix and Sat Tv, Bluetooth speaker with CD and AM and FM radio, a well-equipped kitchen and dining table, high-speed internet 30 Mbps, a big safe that can fit your laptop and access to the buildings common areas such as the gym, the terrace, the grill and the laundry room with a washer and a dryer.

Enjoy Mexico City from within the core location of the most amazing and important cultural, traditional touristic places. While you rest in a kind one-bedroom apartment in a newly refurbished old Downtown classic building located at the corner of Donceles and Cajon del 54, just behind the National Art Museum and only one block away from Bellas Artes.

neighborhood_overview:
"La Condesa" neighborhood is the home of the artistic upper class and is now a super-young, super-stylish neighborhood that's home to some of the city's best food, drink, art, and parks.
Condesa had great architectural bones from its affluent past, a blend of Art Deco mansions and expansive parks. Today, the more laid-back Condesa is known as a haven for dog lovers (yes, really) and young business types, while the edgier Condesa is where you‚Äôll find third-wave coffee shops and pricey hipster boutiques. Condesa neighborhood is equivalent to Soho in NYC or Shoreditch in London.

La Condesa‚Äôs cosmopolitan vibe attracts the likes of artists, students, intellectuals and younger business people who bring their individual styles to the scene.

name: Artist Residency downtown with grdn & art library
description:
A beautiful minimalist building in the heart of Alameda Central. Casa Lomah is ideally located in the Naples district of Mexico City. Offers a rich continental breakfast, artisanal amenities, and a unique space that will make you feel right at home! Experience tranquility, and bring back amazing souvenir photographs on your next Mexico getaway!

The space
FREE breakfast is available every day from 8:30 AM to 11 AM.

REST AND RECHARGE:
Bed 1: Queen Bed

THE AREA:
Casa Lomah is located on the Alameda Central and close to tourist areas such as the Palacio de Bellas Artes and the Z√≥calo. It is 5 km from Chapultepec Forest and 6 km from Chapultepec Castle. We are more than happy to offer our recommendations about the local area and answer any questions you have about the unit or the complex itself. You can reach us through your booking conversation thread, or you can speak to our 24/7 Guest Experience Department.

OCCUPAN
neighborhood_overview: San Miguel Chapultepec is one of the hot and happening ‚Äì though much less well known neighborhoods near the center of Mexico City. Located across from Bosque de Chapultepec, one of the largest city parks in the world it‚Äôs a mix of residential and retail shopping, with plenty of charm mixed in for good luck. The most famous attraction is the Chapultepec Castle. Its rich history and architecture makes this palace a must-see site. In recent years colonia San Miguel Chapultepec has become a residential artistic area, with a mix of tree-lined streets, art galleries, stately homes, old buildings, and cultural points of interest.
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "Th√©√¢tre a la D√©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in M√©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

neighborhood_overview:
Cultural zone of the great metropolis. This district in the south of the city is famous for being a refuge for intellectuals and artists. Its center preserves the bohemian air that enamored people like Leon Trotsky, Emilio "El Indio" Fernandez, Salvador Novo and Salvador Elizondo, who chose this neighborhood to live.
One of the main attractions of the neighborhood is the Frida Kahlo Museum, known as "The Blue House", the former residence of Russian politician Leon Trotsky, among other museums, including cafes, bars, restaurants and markets.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the vibrant, alternative, Bohemian neighborhood near bars, restaurants, museums, the historic center, parks near all the major avenues. Walk to supermarkets, local stores, street markets & much more.
Condesa is the trendiest neighborhood in all of Mexico City, nested close to the city center. It‚Äôs safe and peaceful environment allows you to freely move around and explore numerous attractions and places of interest.

We are in the heart of Condesa a perfect choice for starting your day near all the major attractions and yet still safe.

Please refer to our guidebook for a detailed list of local attractions and places of interest.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Mexico City, where are live and work to this day. I have embarked on a quest to create a space full of positive energy and high comforts where guests can freely relax and socialize, expand their connections and already existing networks.¬†

The artsy bohemian neighborhood felt like the ideal location for such space as it radiates the vibes I enjoy the most. I am looking to provide the best possible experience for guests visiting the city while unlocking their creative potential! There is nothing more reassuring and calming than finding a place that feels like a second home on your travels. I try to provide the things I like when I travel, the social aspect plus the comfort part. I had the opportunity to know many places in the world and I infused this place with all my learnings.¬†

I enjoy getting in a good workout, whether it is through martial arts, yoga, skateboarding, or surfing. Sitting down and talking to different people from different cultures and backgrounds is helping me to grow as a person the most!

Feel free to contact me with any questions you might have, or even if you want to say hi.

I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.
neighbourhood: Mexico City, Ciudad de M√©xico, Mexico

I try to provide the things I like when I travel, the social aspect plus the comfort part. I had the opportunity to know many places in the world and I infused this place with all my learnings.¬†

I enjoy getting in a good workout, whether it is through martial arts, yoga, skateboarding, or surfing. Sitting down and talking to different people from different cultures and backgrounds is helping me to grow as a person the most!

Feel free to contact me with any questions you might have, or even if you want to say hi.

I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.

neighborhood_overview: One of Mexico City‚Äôs most upper-class neighborhoods, Polanco is replete with high-end hotels and shopping malls as well as important theaters, art galleries, and museums. It is also home to some of Latin America‚Äôs best restaurants and a number of cutting-edge bars. Our guide offers you a list of a few of our favorite places to help you plan your time in this beautiful neighborhood in Mexico‚Äôs capital. Read on for our list of what to do in Polanco.  Tacos al pastor is the specialty here. Although it's no roadside stand, it gives travelers the same authentic goodness without the risk of getting an upset stomach. While there are some mezcal cocktails, the standard drink for tacos is beer or flavored water. The cucumber water and the hibiscus flower water (agua de jamaica) is especially refreshing. neighborhood_overview: One of Mexico City‚Äôs most upper-class neighborhoods, Polanco is replete with high-end hotels and shopping malls as well as important theaters, art galleries, and museums. It is also home to some of Latin America‚Äôs best restaurants and a number of cutting-edge bars. Our guide offers you a list of a few of our favorite places to help you plan your time in this beautiful neighborhood in Mexico‚Äôs capital. Read on for our list of what to do in Polanco.  Tacos al pastor is the specialty here. Although it's no roadside stand, it gives travelers the same authentic goodness without the risk of getting an upset stomach. While there are some mezcal cocktails, the standard drink for tacos is beer or flavored water. The cucumber water and the hibiscus flower water (agua de jamaica) is especially refreshing.  Antara is a small shopping mall with a high-class shiny feel. You can find a number of international stores here, from high-street retailers like Zara and Mango to designers like Carolina Herre

Ju√°rez es la combinaci√≥n perfecta de tradici√≥n hist√≥rica y ocio contempor√°neo, hay algo para ver, hacer o probar cada dos cuadras: arquitectura neocolonial y de mediados de siglo, caf√©s elegantes, restaurantes frescos y tiendas de moda. neighborhood_overview:
Polanco is a prestigious neighborhood located in the Miguel Hidalgo borough of Mexico City. Often referred to as the "Beverly Hills of Mexico," Polanco boasts a high concentration of luxury shopping, upscale restaurants, high-net-worth individuals, and diplomatic missions and embassies, making it one of the most exclusive and expensive real estate markets in Latin America.

The neighborhood is particularly renowned for its luxury shopping along Masaryk Avenue, the most expensive street in Mexico, which features high-end designer stores such as Louis Vuitton, Cartier, Chanel, Salvatore Ferragamo, and Tiffany & Co. Additionally, Polanco has several department stores, including the largest department store in Latin America, Palacio de Hierro, and a Liverpool department store.

Polanco is also home to several notable cultural institutions, including the Museo Soumaya, the Modern Art Museum, and Chapultepec Castle, all located in Chapultepec Park. The neighborhood has ma

Capitalia is a professional property management company that seeks to maximize the experience of our guests!
Our goal is for you to experience comfort, convenience, and safety. We want you to get to know the city where you are going to stay better with the help of our personal guide. We're here to help, we'll be quick to answer any questions, and our goal is to make sure you have a fabulous time and become the best lodging option in Mexico.

Not long ago, we envision a place where the architecture and design merged with great quality and service. Homes with soul, where people from all over the world could live a genuine experience of Mexico.¬†

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.¬†

We are HOST ME TENDER, a team of hosts with a gentle perspective on hospitality. We are currently hosting over 80 homes in M√©xico City and Tulum. And it has been an amazing journey!

Each day we are more convinced that what we are doing is right because we believe that traveling is having the local experience and getting around many wonderful places. But by the end of the day, there is nothing better than feeling at home.

Welcome home!

_________________________________________________________________________

Chico is a bright, stylish city center building, perfect base to explore, located in a secure block between beautiful Parque Mexico and iconic Amsterdam avenue in the charming neighborhood of Condesa carefully design and decorated by notable Mexican architects with wonderful restaurants and shops within walking distance, the atmosphere in the neighborhood is lovely, you will find local and specialty stores, the architectural style of the old city, terraces in summer, cultural centers.

The space

Guest access

neighborhood_overview: La Condesa is an iconic neighborhood of Mexico City. Famous for its caf√©s, bookstores, restaurants, art galleries, boutiques, and nightlife. It is considered to be one of the most fashionable and trend neighborhoods, full of artists, students, and intellectuals. Easy access from the main streets of the city and close to public transport makes this place the perfect location to start exploring the city.
host_about:
Not long ago, we envision a place where the architecture and design merged with great quality and service. Homes with soul, where people from all over the world could live a genuine experience of Mexico.¬†

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.¬†

We are HOST ME TENDER, a team of hosts with a gentle perspective on hospitality. We are currently hosting over 80 homes in M√©xico City and Tulum. And it has been an amazing journey!

Each day we are more convinced that what we are doing is right because we believe that traveling is having the local experience and getting around many wonderful places. But by the end of the day, there is nothing better than feeling at home.

Welcome home!

We stayed in different parts of the city (mostly the historic center), but it wasn't until we discovered Roma and Condesa that we understood why people make this their permanent home. We want to help our clients find a home so they can fall in love with this city as well! Combined, we have over 10 years of experience in real estate and we've established some strong relationships with family oriented landlords to provide quality and stress free rentals.

name: Gorgeous Suite - Colmena Centro
description: Located right in the spot of the main attractions of Mexico City, Colmena Down Town is the place to be if you want to visit. Live history while staying in this restored XVIII century building. We want you to feel special and enjoy our place thats why we created amazing amenities such as kitchen, business center, gym, patio, fire pit, dinning area, laundry and much more! Our staff always friendly will make you feel home. Welcome to Colmena!
neighborhood_overview: Right in the spot, we are located in a beautiful calmed street of Centro Historico a few steps away from the Zocalo. Within walking distance you will be able to meet the most iconic museums and monuments of Mexico, lots of restaurants, markets, bars, shopping, cultural centers and much more. Live the Mexican culture like in no other place. Walking or bicycle is the best way to go. Let us know if you have any questions!

host_about:
Not long ago, we envision a place where the architecture and design merged with great quality and service. Homes with soul, where people from all over the world could live a genuine experience of Mexico.¬†

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.¬†

We are HOST ME TENDER, a team of hosts with a gentle perspective on hospitality. We are currently hosting over 80 homes in M√©xico City and Tulum. And it has been an amazing journey!

Each day we are more convinced that what we are doing is right because we believe that traveling is having the local experience and getting around many wonderful places. But by the end of the day, there is nothing better than feeling at home.

Welcome home!

_________________________________________________________________________

As√≠ que decidimos dise√±ar estos hogares con todo lo necesario para que puedas disfrutar de tus vacaciones o para inspirarte y llevar tu trabajo a un lugar m√°gico fuera de casa. Cuidamos todos los detalles para que cada espacio pueda satisfacer tus necesidades.¬†

Somos HOST ME TENDER. Un equipo de anfitriones con una perspectiva c√°lida de hospitalidad. Contamos con m√°s de 80 departamentos en Ciudad de M√©xico y Tulum. ¬°Ha sido una experiencia incre√≠ble!

Cada d√≠a estamos m√°s convencidos de que lo que estamos haciendo es lo correcto porque creemos que viajar es vivir la experiencia local y conocer lugares maravillosos. Pero al final del d√≠a, no hay nada mejor que sentirse como en casa.¬†

host_about:
Hola!  Gusto en conocerte. Soy Gaby Madrid.
Ser√° un placer poderte hospedar.
Me gusta recomendar lugares que visitar en la Ciudad de M√©xico, es una Ciudad Hermosa, que ofrece lugares incre√≠bles para todos, ya sea que viajes con la familia, con amigos, o de trabajo, para descansar, de vacaciones o por conocer una Ciudad que de verdad te encantar√°.
Hay muchos lugares que conocer: el Centro de la Ciudad, museos, restaurantes, bares, caf√©s, centros comerciales, plazas, parques, lugares donde la gente local comemos y disfrutamos de un buen caf√©. Estar√© disponible para recomendarte lugares si as√≠ lo deseas. 
Nuestro principal objetivo es ofrecer estancias en lugares tranquilos, seguros, muy bien ubicados, cerca de los lugares m√°s importantes de la Ciudad.
Como hu√©sped siempre busco lugares c√©ntricos donde hospedarme, restaurantes que me ofrezcan comida t√≠pica, a buen precio, donde pueda hacer una sobremesa agradable.
Como anfitri√≥n me gusta recomendar lugares, preguntanos a tu llegada y con gusto te recomendaremos lugares que visitar.
Bienvenidos a la Ciudad de M√©xico CDMX!

Hello! Nice to meet you, I am Gaby Madrid. 
I love to recommend places of Mexico City. It is a big city that offers many places for everybody: very good food, a lot of places to drink something and enjoy the days with your family and friends, cultural places, trendy places, shopping, walking, coffees, fun, etc. 
You will love Mexico City too.
Our main priority is to offer to all of our guests places with great location in Mexico City, safe and quiet places, in order to let you enjoy the City and to get a very pleasant stay.
Me, as guest, I always choose safe places, good located: in known neighborhoods of the cities, excellent hosts, places that allows me to walk around, to eat very well in special places: local places, not so expensive, but the most important: tasty and excellent local food, I like to know the most important places, and hoping to love the place, so I will surely travel there again.
As host, I will welcome you and could recommend places to visit in Mexico City when you arrive if you like to.
About our places: Please check the dates, if some of them is booked, we have more places in very good neighborhoods as well, please ask me, it will be a pleasure to receive you.
Welcome to Mexico City!

neighborhood_overview:
Safe, quiet and excellently located neighborhood for any guest, it has several self-service stores less than 5 minutes away and a Walmart 10 minutes away, both walking distances.

Right next to us, we have the Nueva Santa Maria neighborhood that is full of restaurants, cafeterias and ice cream parlors of all kinds (Argentine, sushi, ribs, tacos, seafood, hamburgers, bakerys, etc).

In addition to restaurants, you can find establishments less than a 10-minute walk away with many services such as: laundries, dry cleaners, ironing, beauty salons, dentists, doctors offices, ATMs, etc.

Also 10 min. away there is a huge park, full of vegetation where there is activity all the time, therefore it is very safe and the people are very friendly.

Are you ready to experience the vibrant and Bohemian neighborhood of Roma, one of the trendiest and most exciting areas in all of Mexico City? This place is an absolute must-visit for anyone who loves the arts, great food, and fascinating history.

Stroll through the charming streets, and take in the colorful facades and architectural landmarks that make this neighborhood so special. Whether you're looking for a cozy cafe, a delicious restaurant, or a cool bar, Roma has something to offer for every taste.
